meanings.sent1: The bread dough was yeasty, with tiny bubbles forming as it rose.
meanings.sent2: The smell of fresh bread filled the kitchen, yeasty and warm.
meanings.sent3: The yeasty aroma of the bakery made everyone's stomachs growl in hunger.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was yeasty, infectious and bubbly, spreading joy to all around.
meanings.sent5: The yeasty scent of the beer brewery lingered in the air, inviting passersby to take a sip.

meanings.sent1: The children's yeasty enthusiasm for the game was contagious, spreading to all the players.
meanings.sent2: The party was yeasty, with music blaring and people dancing everywhere.
meanings.sent3: His yeasty spirit lifted the mood of the entire room, turning frowns into smiles.
meanings.sent4: The yeasty atmosphere of the concert hall buzzed with anticipation for the performance.
meanings.sent5: The yeasty cheers of the crowd filled the stadium, urging the team to victory.

meanings.definition: Tending to produce new ideas or innovations.
meanings.sent1: The yeasty brainstorming session led to a flood of creative solutions to the problem.
meanings.sent2: Her mind was yeasty, constantly churning with new concepts and possibilities.
meanings.sent3: The yeasty discussions in the think tank sparked a revolution in the industry.
meanings.sent4: His yeasty approach to problem-solving always resulted in groundbreaking inventions.
meanings.sent5: The yeasty exchange of ideas in the workshop inspired everyone to think outside the box.
